Finding Aid for
Henry Katz papers,1919.
titlepage.author:
Finding aid prepared by:
Len Coombs

did.abstract: Soldier from New York City, N.Y., member of Medical Detachment, 339th U.S. Infantry who served in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, the "Polar Bear Expedition." Collection includes summary of his activities and military orders relating to his service in the Polar Bear expedition to Archangel.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Henry Katz, of New York, New York, in 1965 (Donor no.: 4226).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Henry Katz papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Resident of New York City, served as captain, Medical Detachment, 339th Infantry.

scopecontent.p: The papers include a copy of the "Summary of activities of medical personnel with 1st Battalion 339th Infantry, Sept. 1918-May 1919, which describes medical work at Shenkursk and fighting at Toulgas, Sept. 1918; Kodema[?], Dec. 1918; and Vistafka, Jan.-Feb. 1919. Also included are Katz's promotion and discharge papers.
